com.aloqa.trax.shared.saps
Class KNNRequest

java.lang.Object
  com.aloqa.trax.shared.saps.AsynchronousRequest
      com.aloqa.trax.shared.saps.AsynchronousMultiTargetRequest
          com.aloqa.trax.shared.saps.KNNRequest
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.aloqa.trax.shared.io.Serialisable, com.aloqa.trax.shared.saps.AppIdIntegrator, com.aloqa.trax.shared.saps.MultiTarget, com.aloqa.trax.shared.saps.Request
public class KNNRequest
extends com.aloqa.trax.shared.saps.AsynchronousMultiTargetRequest

Use this request to keep up-to-date about the ordered k-nearest-neighbors of a mobile target user. Hence, every time the constellation or the order of the k nearest neighbors of the specified user changes, App_SAP_TraXAPI.update(String, AsynchronousResponse) is invoked with a corresponing KNNResponse-object.
A KNNRequest can be very handy, for instance, to keep distance-sorted buddy lists up-to-date, e.g., in an instance messaging application.
Similar to ProximityObservation, a KNNRequest is associated with a fuzziness interval that allows to trade-off detection accuracy and efficiency when desired. In the case of KNNRequest, the so-called borderline tolerance b has the following implications:

If a target ti is, as a matter of ground truth, a user u's mth nearest neighbor, and another target tj is, as a matter of ground truth, a user u's m+1th nearest neighbor, then TraX can report the order incorrectly (i.e., ti is reported to be on place m+1 and tj on place m), if, and only if, the difference between the true distances between ti and u and tj and u, diff(dist(ti,u),dist(tj,u)), is less than or equal to the borderline tolerance b.

Constructor Detail

KNNRequest

public KNNRequest(java.lang.String id,
                  java.lang.String handleId,
                  java.lang.String MT,
                  java.lang.String[] MTs,
                  int k,
                  int borderlineTolerance)
Creates a new KNNRequest with the given parameters.

Parameters:
id - The id of this ProximityRequest, cp. AsynchronousRequest.
handleId - The handleId of this ProximityRequest, cp. AsynchronousRequest.
MT - The id of the user whose k nearest neighbors are to be observed.
MTs - A set of neighbors of user MT. Among these neighbors, the k nearest neighbors are observed.
k - The number k of nearest neighbors to observe. Note that k <= MTs.length.
borderlineTolerance - The borderline tolerance in meters.
